Step 1: Install Unravel EC2 node for Amazon EMR¶

Unravel 4.4 : Step 1: Install Unravel EC2 node for Amazon EMR

Created by katch, last modified by Raymond Lui on Oct 19, 2018
Table of Contents
  • Introduction
  • Requirements Checklist
  • 1. Setup the EC2 instance for unravel installation.
    • Provision an EC2 Instance
    • Configure the EC2 node at first login
  • 2. Install the Unravel EMR rpm on the created EC2 instance.
  • 3. Login to Unravel Web UI

Introduction

This topic explains how to deploy Unravel Server 4.4.X on AWS EC2 instance that will be used to monitor existing or newly created EMR clusters. For instructions that correspond to older versions of Unravel Server, contact Unravel Support.

Workflow Summary
  1. Setup the EC2 instance for unravel installation.
  2. Install the Unravel EMR RPM on the created EC2 instance.
  3. Log into Unravel Web UI.

Requirements Checklist

Platform Compatibi lity Base OS for EC2 EC2 instance type & size Security Group / IAM role

:sup:`AWS EMR 5.x (5.14 preferred ) `

EMR Support Matrix

Hiv e 0.9.x 2.3.x

Spa rk 1.3.x, 1.6.x - 2.3.x

Base OS Redhat/CentOS 6.4 - 7.4

Recomme nded Centos 7.4 AMI

e.g.  a mi-02e98f78 (in us-east-1)

Minimum: R4.2xlarge (60 GB Ram)

:sup:`Recommen ded: R4.4xlarge (122 GB Ram) `

Virtuali zation type: HVM

Root device type: EBS – 100 - 500GB
Allowed ports for inbound access to unravel EC2 node:
Port 3000 Port 4043

EC2 instance profile that has permission to Read the S3 bucket used in the EMR clusters.
Below is an example of security group used for Unravel EC2 node.
Inbound rule

1. Setup the EC2 instance for unravel installation.

Provision an EC2 Instance

  • Instance Type: r4.2xlarge; recommended r4.4xlarge; the instance type: HVM with EBS.[

  • OS: centos7.4 (ami-02e98f78)

  • Minimum root disk space is 100GB. Recommendation: 200GB or above with “Provisioned IOPS SSD (IO1)” storage.

  • The EC2 instance must be in same region with the target EMR clusters which Unravel EC2 node will be monitoring.

  • Create a S3 ReadAccess only IAM role and assign it to Unravel EC2 node to READ the archive logs on the S3 bucket configured for the EMR cluster.

    For instance, create an IAM role that contains the policy that only READ the specific S3 bucket used on EMR cluster. Then create a EC2 instance profile and add the IAM role to it. SeeCreating IAM RoleandCreate Instance Profile CLI

  • Security Group or policy required for Unravel EC2 node:
    Unravel EC2 node works with multiple EMR clusters, including existing and newly created clusters. A TCP & UDP connection is needed from the EMR master node to Unravel EC2 node. You must
    • create a security group that allows port 3000 and port 4043 from EMR cluster nodes IP address, or
    • put the member of security group used on EMR cluster in this rule.

Below is an example of security group used for Unravel EC2 node.
Inbound rule
Type P r o t o c o l Po rt Ra ng e Source
All traffic A l l Al l SG ID of this group or Subnet IP block (e.g. 10.10.0.0/16)
SSH T C P 22 0.0.0.0/0
Custom TCP Rule T C P 30 00 SG ID used on EMR cluster or Subnet IP block (if IP block belong to different VPC)  is required for VPC peering connection
Custom TCP Rule T C P 40 43 SG ID used on EMR cluster or Subnet IP block (if IP block belong to different VPC)  is required for VPC peering connection

Outbound rule

Type P r o t o c o l Po rt Ra ng e Source
All traffic A l l Al l 0.0.0.0/0

Configure the EC2 node at first login

  • Disable selinux.

  • Edit the file to make sure the setting persists after reboot and make sure “SELINUX=permissive”.

  • Install libaio.x86_64 and lzop.x86_64.

  • Start ntp  and check time

  • Create a new user hadoop.

    confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information

    In a PoC or evaluation, the minimal root disk size 100GB should be sufficient. When monitoring more EMR clusters or lots of jobs, we recommend to set minimal root disk from 300 - 500GB “Provisioned IOPS” EBS volume with 3000 IOPS.

    For production unravel use case, 200GB root disk Provisioned IOPS EBS and RDS are recommended

2. Install the Unravel EMR rpm on the created EC2 instance.

confluence-information-macro has-no-icon confluence-information-macro-warning

Reminder

AWS EMR 5.x support is available via Unravel 4.3.1.6 only

  • Get the Unravel Server RPM; see Download Unravel Software. Look for 4.3.1.6 EMR rpm download instruction.

  • Install the Unravel Server RPM.  The precise filename can vary, depending on how it was fetched or copied.

  • Run the specified await_fixups.sh script to make sure background processing is finished before going on to further steps. In a routine upgrade, it is okay to start all Unravel daemons, but do not stop or restart them until the await_fixups.sh prints “Done". This may take a few minutes.

  • Edit the /usr/local/unravel/etc/unravel.propertiesfile to append the following line in it.

    For monitoring EMR spark service, add the following properties in the unravel.properties file.

    confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information

    The installation creates /usr/local/unravel/ which contains the executables, scripts, and settings. User unravel is created. The initial internal database and other durable states are put in /srv/unravel/ for larger storage.
    The master configuration file is in /usr/local/unravel/etc/unravel.properties and the logs are in /usr/local/unravel/logs/. The RPM installation creates user unravel (if not already existing), /etc/init.d/unravel_* scripts for controlling services, and /etc/init.d/unravel_all.sh which can be used to manually stop, start, and get status of all daemons in proper order.
    During initial install, a bundled database is used; you can switch to use AWS RDS for production.

    confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-warning

    Security Remind

    We do not recommend making Unravel Server UI accessible on the public Internet.

3. Login to Unravel Web UI

  • Start Unravel daemons.

  • Create a ssh tunnel from your workstation to the Unravel EC2 node.

  • From your workstation browser, navigate to URL http://127.0.0.1:3000. Login to the unravel UI with user id: admin and password: unraveldata.* *Congratulations! Unravel EC2 node is up and running. You can proceed to connect to your existing or new EMR clusters.* *
